I hope we never forget your dedication to our nation, and I'll do whatever I can to make sure we don't. 
I recognize that so many of our veterans from a multitude of conflicts and deployments are enduring deep feelings about what's happening in Afghanistan right now.

1427739413942046723.text: To the service members who were deployed to Afghanistan, the Gold Star families who've lost a loved one while stationed there & those who supported a member of our military while they fought in that country – nothing can shake the gratitude I feel for your service & sacrifice.

1427654242286727174.text: Now that the American presence has been removed from that country, the Biden White House needs to provide a realistic plan for how we're going to keep Afghanistan from backsliding into a dangerous threat to American citizens.

1427654239623335942.text: Our mission in Afghanistan was to root out the forces that made it a hub for terrorist activity. In that, we succeeded for two decades.

1427654238058860548.text: Pulling them out in this sloppy, haphazard public spectacle complete w/helicopter evacuations from the Kabul embassy has handed the Taliban a very public victory & created a dangerous vacuum being filled by terrorists who hate women, freedom, diversity, democracy & America.

1427654236985200642.text: Most of the roughly 2,500 troops still in Afghanistan were support personnel: intelligence specialists and special operations troops.

1427654234636394502.text:
I’ve met with Washington state troops and Afghani women leaders while in Afghanistan, and now I worry that their service and sacrifice has been set back or even erased. The truth is, we'd already pulled the vast majority of our forces out of the country years ago.

1359996064187748356.text: Congress has provided the funding and resources needed to safely reopen schools – now it’s time for President Biden to make good on his promises, listen to the science, and work to safely reopen schools. Our students and parents cannot wait any longer. (5/5)

1262402030787866629.text: 40 years ago today, #MountStHelens erupted, spewing hot rock, gas, and ash across Southwest Washington, killing 57 people and forever altering the landscape surrounding the monument. 1262171121132191748.text: I'm committed to preserving this kind of access to the Mount St. Helens area & will continue working to protect nearby communities that must keep a watchful eye on the impacts from the eruption – even four decades later. 🌋(3/3) https://t.co/fgGekGAWkF

1262171116602298370.text: The major bummer was losing my hat halfway up & getting a bad sunburn where my hair was parted! But overall it was a very rewarding experience that I will never forget.
